Articles.Content:
Voting now open for FASA part.

IVA Mercury

http://www.google.com/url?sa=i&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=images&cd=&cad=rja&uact=8&docid=ScCysc_RNl0D_M&tbnid=imnJK1cOBjwTcM:&ved=0CAUQjRw&url=http%3A%2F%2Fhistory.nasa.gov%2Fdiagrams%2Fmercury.html&ei=Z-h3U_HbENGKqgbWuYCQDA&bvm=bv.66917471,d.b2k&psig=AFQjCNEqJJnqj870e2gBdH2l-FmgBQjPiA&ust=1400453542250672

Apollo SM mini probe

http://nssdc.gsfc.nasa.gov/nmc/spacecraftDisplay.do?id=1971-063D

Surveyor probe core

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Surveyor_program

Probe Sized RTG

http://www.wired.com/images_blogs/wiredscience/2012/07/general-purpose-heat-source-module-gphs-rtg-test.jpg

M-1 engine

http://www.astronautix.com/engines/m1.htm

RL-10 is being made along with a multi-engine adapter.

Edited May 17, 2014 by frizzank

Now that one is a hard decision. I vote Apollo Microsatellite, for a little more complete Apollo overview. Denny mentioned that he's making Surveyor and Mercury IVA, so I'm not going for those, but honestly, I'll probably be happy with any part that wins. I say, despite all the drama, this is a good wrap-up, with every major piece of hardware from early US manned space program present.
What would the Apollo SM mini probe look like?

http://nssdc.gsfc.nasa.gov/nmc/spacecraftDisplay.do?id=1971-063D

Image on this page is what they looked like. Two were released, on Apollos 15 and 16. The Apollo 16 one had a heck of a ride through the Moon's "lumpy" gravity field.
Oh dang. I voted mercury IVA- these polls are soooo close!
It was a tough vote from M-1 and Surveyor probe core but I have to say Surveyor since that was much more historic.
Things that will never be true: There are enough rocket engines for KSP.
Moore BooStersss!!!!
Things that will extra-super never be true: there are enough rocket engines without tank butts in KSP.

Things that will extra-super never be true: there are enough rocket engines without tank butts in KSP.

Exactly what I wanted to say! I just didn't know how to.

Seriously a Mercury IVA isn't going to be much different from the stock capsule. I mean it would be cool but it just seems frizzs skills could be used for something we can use beyond an IVA for one capsule.
Well, that, and the fact Denny mentioned he's making a Mercury IVA.

Seriously a Mercury IVA isn't going to be much different from the stock capsule. I mean it would be cool but it just seems frizzs skills could be used for something we can use beyond an IVA for one capsule.

I agree,the FASA pack is so complete with engines to this phase,if miss something,i feel is an IVA Mercury,because the other spacecrafts have (GEMINI-BIG GEMINI-GEMINI LANDER and LEM the last two from Denny).

I believe must add this IVA (Mercury) before this pack go a step forward,with engines,tanks and other staff-equipment.

I agree,the FASA pack is so complete with engines to this phase,if miss something,i feel is an IVA Mercury,because the other spacecrafts have (GEMINI-BIG GEMINI-GEMINI LANDER and LEM the last two from Denny).

I believe must add this IVA (Mercury) before this pack go a step forward,with engines,tanks and other staff-equipment.

But Denny is already making a Mercury IVA. So I think it would be better to make an M-1 engine (or better, the Nova (Saturn C-8) parts. Why aren't they up for voting???)
I voted for the Surveyor probe core.

But Denny is already making a Mercury IVA. So I think it would be better to make an M-1 engine (or better, the Nova (Saturn C-8) parts. Why aren't they up for voting???)

I know my friend,about Denny he will do this,but maybe about some reasons,never complete this IVA.

When i see this thread with frizzank,ask us for vote,and i see this include the Mercury IVA,i vote (the IVA),because i am sure,if "win" the IVA,frizzank do it sure.

I think will be to the FASA Project(IVA),because frizzank put it if win,Denny only speak about this,don't have it to his program "Official".

Edited May 18, 2014 by CERVERUS

But Denny is already making a Mercury IVA. So I think it would be better to make an M-1 engine (or better, the Nova (Saturn C-8) parts. Why aren't they up for voting???)

I agree wholeheartedly. Also, bigger is always better and the M-1 or Nova are much larger than the mercury capsule!
M-1... This bit added because otherwise this post would be too short.

I voted for my original suggestion, the Surveyor core. I think that it would make for a good base for mid-tree probes, as there isn't really anything that fits this role. The M-1 would essentially be a scaled up, and slightly different F-1. I think that something that allows for a good aesthetic, as well as a good base for smaller science parts would be much more valuable to a player than another Mainsail.
Im surprised the probe core is doing so well. I thought the M1 would win by leaps and bounds...

Joking aside, KSP lacks variety in probe cores much more than in engines. There's all the gray/blocky Probo-dobro/washboard stuff, there's the very modern gold foil AIES stuff, there's a couple from SXT, and that's about it. There are custom probes from Lionhead, sure, but it's hard to make them generic mid-60s probes.

I would have suggested Ranger block I (which was also used for Mariner) but to do it justice it'd need both the core and the extended boom, which isn't one part no way no how.

I voted for my original suggestion, the Surveyor core. I think that it would make for a good base for mid-tree probes, as there isn't really anything that fits this role. The M-1 would essentially be a scaled up, and slightly different F-1. I think that something that allows for a good aesthetic, as well as a good base for smaller science parts would be much more valuable to a player than another Mainsail.

Actually, an M-1 would essentially be an upper stage F-1. I just checked, and it was more like an ultrahuge J-2. There is some room for engine like that, but still, I believe that it's the second least interesting piece in this pool (the only thing behind it is the RTG piece, because we have a good one from stock). I'd rather have an Apollo microsat or the Surveyor.
I choose option (F.) All of the above.
Nice poll IVA Mercury!
The M1 would also be the largest engine in FASA, and would go with the 7.5m nova tanks well.
